result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Nava

[ma] Cases 21CF180, 21CF297, 21CT588, 21CT603, 22CF87, 22CF137, 22CF401 called at 2:51pm 
Defendant Eric Nava in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Eric Nava.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

On Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond in Case 22CF401:
--Arguments given by Atty De La Rosa
--Arguments in opposition given by DA Hall

The Court modifies bond in 22CF401 to $2500 CASH. 

recess: 3:00pm

Motion hearing on November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on November 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on January 17, 2023 at 09:30 am.

[ma] Cases 21CF180, 21CF297, 21CT588, 21CT603, 22CF87, 22CF137, 22CF401 called at 9:02 AM 
Defendant Eric Nava in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Eric Nava.  Attorney Theresa A Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment occur in Case 22CF411: 
Mr. Nava waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, Defense demands speedy trial.

Status conference on October 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ae] cases 21CF180, 21CF297, 21CT588, 21CT603, 22CF87, 22CF137, 22CF401 called 2:56 PM Defendant Eric Nava in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court. ADA Witt in court for State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa provides status of cases and requests an additional status be scheduled in about 30 days. ADA Witt infroms the Court that Prelim in 22CF401 is still needed 

NEXT: Prelim for 22CF401 /Status for other cases 10/28/22 at 9:00 am 
recess: 2:58 pm
Status conference on September 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ma] Cases 21CF180, 21CF297, 21CT588, 21CT603, 22CF87,22CF137 called at 2:59pm 
Defendant Eric Nava in court.   Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Eric Nava. Attorney Theresa A Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Arraignment occurs in Case 22CF87 & 22CF137:
--service of both Informations admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

As to Case 22CF87: Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing occurs as to $300 posted on 2/16/22. 
The Court orders 1/2 of bond forfeit ($150), remainder is to be brought out of default and remain on file. 
recess: 3:08pm  

NEXT:   Status Conference on 9/30/22 at 2:30pm
Arraignment on August 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[ml] Cases 21CF180, 21CF297, 21CT588, 21CT603, 22CF87, and 22CF137 called at 4:23PM
Defendant Eric Nava in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant updates his address to as follows: 314 N 3rd St, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538.

As to files 22CF87 and 22CF137:
The Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearings; the Court accepts these waivers and binds him over for Trials.

The Court declines to proceed to Arraignment in these files, and instead defers it to another date and time.

recess 4:29PM

NEXT: 
As to files 22CF87 and 22CF137:
Arraignment on 08/16 at 2:00PM (all other files to track along for Status Conference)
Bond Payment information
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Amended Bond, Conditions of this Bond include: no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription

[MK] cases #21CF180, #21CF297, #21CT588, #21CT603, #22CF87, #22CF137 called at 1:48pm.
Defendant Eric Nava appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (Attorney De La Rosa is PD-appointed counsel in these cases).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Arguments are given on bond. 
In case #22CF87 the Court requires that an additional $200 Cash Bond be posted.
In case #22CF137 the Court modifies the bond from a Signature Bond to now be a $300 Cash Bond with the same conditions as previously ordered.  
recess 1:54pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearings in cases #22CF87 and #22CF137, and Status Conference in the remaining cases--all on July 7th at 3:30pm
Extradition Forecast
Upon arrest, the Defendant may appear before any Jefferson County magistrate.

Cases 21CF180, 21CF297, 21CT588, 21CT603, 22CF87 and 22CF137 called at 9:56am.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court.   Defendant Eric Nava not in court. Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court and Counsel review case history, status and filings in all matters. 
Atty. De La Rosa has no additional information to provide to the Court regarding the cause of the non-appearance today. 
State moves for issues of a bond only bench warrant in each case and a finding that the bond in each case is in default; so ordered by the Court. 
The Court notes that upon arrest, the Defendant may appear before any Jefferson County magistrate. 
Recess 9:58am
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on June 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions of bond include: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking

[MK] cases #21CF180, #21CF297, #21CT588, #21CT603, #22CF87, #22CF137 called at 1:42pm 
Defendant Eric Nava in court with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney John German appears by telephone on Case #21CF180 and Case #21CF297.  
The Court grants Attorney German's Motion to Withdraw as counsel.  
Attorney German rings off at 1:44pm 
Attorney De La Rosa confirms that he will represent Mr. Nava as PD counsel on all cases.  
_____________________
Initial Appearance is held in Case #22CF137: 
The Court quashes the Warrant.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court requires a $2,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess 1:50pm 

NEXT:   Preliminary Hearing in Cases #22CF87 and #22CF137, and Status Conference on the remaining cases--all on June 3rd at 9:30am
